snippet: Illinois will not be allowed to pay state workers in full during a budget impasse, a Cook County judge ruled Tuesday, leaving some 65,000 employees without a paycheck.
abstract: Illinois Judge Diane Joan Larsen rules that state cannot pay state workers in full while budget impasse is ongoing, decision that will leave 65,000 employees without paychecks while fiscal battle drags on.
lead_paragraph: Illinois will not be allowed to pay state workers in full during a budget impasse, a Cook County judge ruled Tuesday, leaving some 65,000 employees without a paycheck.

headline.main: Illinois: In Absence of Budget, Judge Denies Workers Full Pay
headline.print_headline: Illinois: In Absence of Budget, Judge Denies Workers Full Pay
